body_html:
Sorry for my sudden proposal. Actually, I am talking about how to improve compatibility with Python and its existing libraries such as Sklearn, Pandas and Pylab family (Numpy/Scipy/Matplotlib). I agree that the recent version of tensorflow python wrapping is so much great. However, if it becomes more compatible with recent machine learning and data processing tools in Python, the solution becomes more familiar with current python users including me. So, the addition of pickle mode in input_data.py is made based on this ideology.

Moreover, I am wondering where my contribution is gone. I updated input_data.py here and submitted it a few days ago but I couldn't find it. Please advice me if there is any mistake I made in code contribution.

(James) Sung-Jin Kim
sungjinkim@fas.harvard.edu

body:
Sorry for my sudden proposal. Actually, I am talking about how to improve compatibility with Python and its existing libraries such as Sklearn, Pandas and Pylab family (Numpy/Scipy/Matplotlib). I agree that the recent version of tensorflow python wrapping is so much great. However, if it becomes more compatible with recent machine learning and data processing tools in Python, the solution becomes more familiar with current python users including me. So, the addition of pickle mode in input_data.py is made based on this ideology. 

Moreover, I am wondering where my contribution is gone. I updated input_data.py here and submitted it a few days ago but I couldn't find it. Please advice me if there is any mistake I made in code contribution. 

(James) Sung-Jin Kim
sungjinkim@fas.harvard.edu
